instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]Non-working left Shift, Control and Option key on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I've tried a few different keyboards and they all have this same issue. No left Shift, Control or Option. The board had some minor liquid-damage, nothing in the area of the keyboard or <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> or <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>. <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> has 3.42V at pin 10 and 3.3V at pin 4 and 6. I haven't seen this issue before so I'm not sure what's happening. It appears that <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> must not be doing what it's supposed to. Not sure though. Let me know if you anyone has any ideas about this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Non-working left Shift, Control and Option key on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Keyboard must get 3V42 at pin 4 of the connector. Then as you press the shift/control/option you should see a voltage on pin 1,2,3. Usually pin 4 in the connector is fucked or 3V42 is missing there.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Non-working left Shift, Control and Option key on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Ok, got it. Thanks for explaining the concept. It was the connector. 3V42 was there but it wasn't getting sent over when the key was pressed. Everything's working great now.
